Exaggeration: The claim by President Trump that his administration has deported about half of MS-13 gang members may be an exaggeration, as there is no specific data available on the number of MS-13 gang members deported.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no specific data provided to back up the assertion that the administration is at the "50 percent mark" in deporting MS-13 gang members.
Falters at times: President Trump has made similar claims about deporting MS-13 gang members in the past, which have been questioned by experts. This suggests that his statements may falter at times.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that deporting MS-13 gang members is an effective solution to eliminate the gang entirely, which may be a problematic assumption as the gang has grown into an international criminal organization with thousands of members worldwide.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the growth and presence of MS-13 gang members in the United States, such as the historical context of refugees from civil wars in Central America in the 1980s.
